1.text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: because his mercy endureth for ever.

2.text: Let Israel now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

3.text: Let the house of Aaron now say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

4.text: Let them now that fear the LORD say, that his mercy endureth for ever.

5.text: I called upon the LORD in distress: the LORD answered me, and set me in a large place.

6.text: The LORD is on my side; I will not fear: what can man do unto me?

7.text: The LORD taketh my part with them that help me: therefore shall I see my desire upon them that hate me.

8.text: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in man.

9.text: It is better to trust in the LORD than to put confidence in princes.

10.text: All nations compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD will I destroy them.

11.text: They compassed me about; yea, they compassed me about: but in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

12.text: They compassed me about like bees; they are quenched as the fire of thorns: for in the name of the LORD I will destroy them.

13.text: Thou hast thrust sore at me that I might fall: but the LORD helped me.

14.text: The LORD is my strength and song, and is become my salvation.

15.text: The voice of rejoicing and salvation is in the tabernacles of the righteous: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

16.text: The right hand of the LORD is exalted: the right hand of the LORD doeth valiantly.

17.text: I shall not die, but live, and declare the works of the LORD.

18.text: The LORD hath chastened me sore: but he hath not given me over unto death.

19.text: Open to me the gates of righteousness: I will go into them, and I will praise the LORD:

20.text: This gate of the LORD, into which the righteous shall enter.

21.text: I will praise thee: for thou hast heard me, and art become my salvation.

22.text: The stone which the builders refused is become the head stone of the corner.

23.text: This is the LORD'S doing; it is marvellous in our eyes.

24.text: This is the day which the LORD hath made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.

25.text: Save now, I beseech thee, O LORD: O LORD, I beseech thee, send now prosperity.

26.text: Blessed be he that cometh in the name of the LORD: we have blessed you out of the house of the LORD.

27.text: God is the LORD, which hath shewed us light: bind the sacrifice with cords, even unto the horns of the altar.

28.text: Thou art my God, and I will praise thee: thou art my God, I will exalt thee.

29.text: O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
